Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the amount of campaign money received by IDC members from real estate, charter school, and health care lobbyists, by using the phrase "tons of campaign money."
Understate: The claim may understate the connections between the Republican donors and IDC members, as it only mentions that "some" of the lobbyists are Republicans with connections to Trump.
Lack enough support: The claim may lack enough specific evidence or support to prove the extent of the connections between IDC members and Republican donors.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that receiving campaign money from real estate, charter school, and health care lobbyists who are Republicans with connections to Trump automatically implies alignment with Republicans instead of other Democrats.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for why IDC members received campaign money from real estate, charter school, and health care lobbyists, such as policy alignment or other factors.
